headline.main: World Briefing | Africa: Burundi: Fighting Intensifies

lead_paragraph: Ethnic Hutu rebels killed 35 civilians as fighting spread in Burundi just days after a new government was sworn in, officials said. The government, which shares power between ethnic Hutus and Tutsis, is intended to shepherd Burundi away from an ethnic war that has killed more than 200,000 people in eight years. Most political parties are in the new cabinet but the two main rebel groups vowed to continue their war against the Tutsi-dominated army.
abstract: Ethnic Hutu rebels kill 35 civilians as fighting spreads in Burundi just days after new government is sworn in; map (S)
